intro: Cheiranthus scapigerus, commonly known as the scapigerous wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, often found in alpine or coastal areas. Its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange, with four petals arranged in a cross shape. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
